intro: Microloma poicilanthum, commonly known as the variable microloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval fruits. Microloma poicilanthum is often found in arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
